abstracts.cdata!:
This Social and Environmental Screening
            and Assessment Framework (SESAF) has been developed
            specifically for the proposed sub-projects under the Bam
            Earthquake Emergency reconstruction Project in Iran, to
            ensure due diligence, to avoid causing harm or exacerbating
            social tensions, and to ensure consistent treatment of
            social and environmental issues by project authorities, and
            those involved with the project. The framework shall assist
            in the selection of sub-projects, to avoid or minimize as
            possible, any likely social and/or environmental impact,
            identify mitigation, and enforce compliance. In most cases,
            mitigation will be inherent in standard engineering design
            and construction practices. Investments considered to impose
            unacceptable negative environmental impacts will not be
            approved for financing. Checklists have been prepared to be
            submitted with each subproject prior to approval. Any
            subproject causing potential damage to cultural heritage
            sites, will not be financed, as neither will any subproject
            concerning construction of new primary roads or highways.
            Subprojects eligible for project financing include (subject
            to environmental screening approval): provision of equipment
            and construction material for housing and commercial
            buildings; repair of transport infrastructure (airport
            facilities, highway repairs, and village streets);
            telecommunication networks; retrofitting works of the key
            strategic buildings in the Province of Kerman. As part of
            the social framework, the report also addresses
            resettlement, and indigenous population issues.
